lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Luke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Luke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
private static Map<String, CommandAction> commandActionMap = new HashMap<>() {{
public static Map<String, String> parseArguments(CommandAction cmdAction, String[] args) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format("The description of %s cannot be empty.", args[0]));
throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format("The description of %s cannot be empty.", args[0]));
throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format("%s require the %s argument.", args[0], extraArg));
throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format("%s require the %s argument.", args[0], extraArg));
throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format("The index of %s cannot be empty.", args[0]));
public static Command parseCommand(String input) throws UnknownCommandException, IllegalArgumentException {
printOutput("I'll take my leave... Do you know who is my father?");
String msg = "Currently, you have the following tasks:\n";
printOutput("Yay! You have no task to do!");
printOutput(String.format("I have added the following task into list: \n\t%s\nnow you have %d tasks in the list.", task, taskList.size()));
printOutput("Using the force... Great! I have forced this task as done.");
printOutput("Force should be used for greater good!\nI've forced this task as not done yet...");
printOutput(String.format("Forcing it out... Success! I've removed the following task:\n\t%s", removedTask));
printOutput("Oops, the force does not support this action.\nPlease try again :(");
printOutput("Oops, the force cannot find the task.\nPlease try again :(");
printOutput("Oops, the force cannot convert the value to a number.\nPlease try again :(");
printOutput(String.format("Oops, the force is not strong.\n%s\nPlease try again :(", e.getMessage()));
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
REM create bin directory if it doesn't exist
REM delete output from previous run
REM compile the code into the bin folder
REM run the program, feed commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to the ACTUAL.TXT
